title: Comment on This Gay Man Was Beaten Because, According To Attacker: ‘We Have A New President, Faggot’ by The Golden State of hate: “I don’t need to serve you anymore. We’re trying to make America great again” – NEW blog
text:
via Twitter UPDATE: Local police have stated that they were unable to verify this story. Snopes, looking at the evidence , called it “unproven.” 
There is a reason that members of the LGBTQ+ community — among other minority groups — were defiantly fearful of a President Trump. 
This is the reason. 
We argued that his divisive, anti-American rhetoric would embolden people who wanted to commit hate crimes and violence against people who were different from them. 
It has. 
Bhaveek N. Makan reported on Twitter about his friend Chris Ball who was attacked for being gay, not long after the annoucement of Donald J. Trump as our next President. Woke up to hear my great friend was physically attacked last night for being gay. "We have a new president faggot" he was told. I'm hurt. pic.twitter.com/bDJjHl2dyT 
— Bhaveek N. Makan (@TehBhav) November 9, 2016 
A little more context to the story and what exactly happened: via Twitter 
The story was also posted by Chris’ friend, K.C. MacPherson: 
According to these reports, Chris was on a date with a guy when a total stranger noticed. This stranger assaulted Chris, saying that, “We have a new President, faggot!” 
Some conservatives tried to dismiss this as some kind of hoax, but there is also a Facebook post from Avery Kentis, who accompanied Chris to the emergency room. Facebook 
And posts from Chris himself on Facebook: 
Conservatives are professional deniers, of course, so many still insist the attack was a hoax and that President Trump will be “great for the gays.” Then there is this guy who believes hate crimes are hoaxes, cus "this doesn't feed into my views." pic.twitter.com/BW44alsMRM 
— Bhaveek N. Makan (@TehBhav) November 10, 2016 
The worst may be happening. All we can do is buckle up, batten down the hatches, and look out for each other. As Martin Luther King Jr. once said, “The arc of the moral universe is long, but it bends toward justice.” 
Chris is expected to make a full recovery: 
— Bhaveek N. Makan (@TehBhav) November 9, 2016 
We will resist this, and love will endure. Best wishes of recovery and happiness to Chris. Read This
